identificationModule.briefTitle: The Effectiveness of Upper Extremity Isokinetic Strengthening in Post-stroke Hemiplegia
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effectiveness of Upper Extremity Isokinetic Strengthening in Post-stroke Hemiplegia

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This randomised controlled study will investigate the effectiveness of isokinetic strengthening on the upper extremity functionality and strength in post-stroke hemiplegic patients.

interventions.name: isokinetic strengthening
interventions.description: isokinetic upper extremity (forearm) strengthening for 4 weeks 3d/w

interventions.name: exercise band strengthening
interventions.description: upper extremity (forearm) strengthening with exercise band 4 weeks 3d/w

primaryOutcomes.description: Muscles: forearm flexors and extensors Measurement tool: MicroFET3 (Hoggan Health Industries Inc. West Jordan, UT, USA)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0, 4, 8 weeks (change from baseline upper extremity strength at 4 weeks and at 8 weeks will be assessed)

primaryOutcomes.description: Muscles: wrist flexors and extensors Measurement Tool: CSMI Humac Norm Cybex isokinetic dinamometer (HUMAC® /2009 Version: 10.000.0065, Computer Sports Medicine Inc., USA)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0, 4, 8 weeks (change from baseline pik torque at 4 weeks and at 8 weeks will be assessed)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measurement tool: Jamar Hydraulic Hand Dynamometer (Patterson Medical, Warrenville, IL, USA)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fugl-Meyer Assessment scale for upper extremity
secondaryOutcomes.description: Scale range: 0-66; higher values represent a better outcome; subscales are combined by summing to compute a total score

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Disabilities of the arm, shoulder and hand questionnaire (Part 1)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Scale range: 0-100; higher scores represent more disabilities of the upper limb; Total score (sum of the scores for 30 questions) is put in a formula to compute the DASH disability score
Includes 8 domains and an extra assessment for stroke recovery; scores range 0-100 for each domain; higher scores represent better outcome; a formula is used for scoring each domain.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Active motion in upper extremity
* Brunnstrom's Scale above 3

Exclusion Criteria:

* Unstable medical conditions
* Cognitive problems

references.citation: Kerimov K, Coskun Benlidayi I, Ozdemir C, Gunasti O. The Effects of Upper Extremity Isokinetic Strengthening in Post-Stroke Hemiplegia: A Randomized Controlled Trial. J Stroke Cerebrovasc Dis. 2021 Jun;30(6):105729. doi: 10.1016/j.jstrokecerebrovasdis.2021.105729. Epub 2021 Mar 23.
